intro: Zephyranthes arenicola, commonly known as the sand verbena or sea orchid, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the southern United States and the Caribbean. It thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is adapted to salt spray and coastal conditions. The plant produces delicate, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late summer or early fall. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family, which includes other ornamental and ornamental bulbous plants. Zephyranthes arenicola is often used in coastal landscaping due to its resilience and aesthetic appeal.
